00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomExact.cpp
00003  * \brief Using %RandomLib to generate exact random results
00004  *
00005  * Compile/link with, e.g.,\n
00006  * g++ -I../include -O2 -funroll-loops
00007  *   -o RandomExact RandomExact.cpp ../src/Random.cpp\n
00008  * ./RandomExact
00009  *
00010  * $Id: 8da1b1e685656cf6edb87645aa6d6fd5d2ffaa89 $
00011  *
00012  * See \ref otherdist, for more information.
00013  *
00014  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2012) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00015  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00016  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00017  **********************************************************************/
00018 
00019 #include <iostream>
00020 #include <utility>
00021 #include <RandomLib/Random.hpp>
00022 #include <RandomLib/RandomNumber.hpp>
00023 #include <RandomLib/ExactNormal.hpp>
00024 #include <RandomLib/ExactExponential.hpp>
00025 #include <RandomLib/InversePiProb.hpp>
00026 #include <RandomLib/InverseEProb.hpp>
00027 
00028 int main(int, char**) {
00029   // Create r with a random seed
00030   RandomLib::Random r; r.Reseed();
00031   std::cout << "Using " << r.Name() << "\n"
00032             << "with seed " << r.SeedString() << "\n\n";
00033   {
00034     std::cout
00035       << "Sampling exactly from the normal distribution.  First number is\n"
00036       << "in binary with ... indicating an infinite sequence of random\n"
00037       << "bits.  Second number gives the corresponding interval.  Third\n"
00038       << "number is the result of filling in the missing bits and rounding\n"
00039       << "exactly to the nearest representable double.\n";
00040     const int bits = 1;
00041     RandomLib::ExactNormal<bits> ndist;
00042     long long num = 20000000ll;
00043     long long bitcount = 0;
00044     int numprint = 16;
00045     for (long long i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00046       long long k = r.Count();
00047       RandomLib::RandomNumber<bits> x = ndist(r); // Sample
00048       bitcount += r.Count() - k;
00049       if (i < numprint) {
00050         std::pair<double, double> z = x.Range();
00051         std::cout << x << " = "   // Print in binary with ellipsis
00052                   << "(" << z.first << "," << z.second << ")"; // Print range
00053         double v = x.Value<double>(r); // Round exactly to nearest double
00054         std::cout << " = " << v << "\n";
00055       } else if (i == numprint)
00056         std::cout << std::flush;
00057     }
00058     std::cout
00059       << "Number of bits needed to obtain the binary representation averaged\n"
00060       << "over " << num << " samples = " << bitcount/double(num) << "\n\n";
00061   }
00062   {
00063     std::cout
00064       << "Sampling exactly from exp(-x).  First number is in binary with\n"
00065       << "... indicating an infinite sequence of random bits.  Second\n"
00066       << "number gives the corresponding interval.  Third number is the\n"
00067       << "result of filling in the missing bits and rounding exactly to\n"
00068       << "the nearest representable double.\n";
00069     const int bits = 1;
00070     RandomLib::ExactExponential<bits> edist;
00071     long long num = 100000000ll;
00072     long long bitcount = 0;
00073     int numprint = 16;
00074     for (long long i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00075       long long k = r.Count();
00076       RandomLib::RandomNumber<bits> x = edist(r); // Sample
00077       bitcount += r.Count() - k;
00078       if (i < numprint) {
00079         std::pair<double, double> z = x.Range();
00080         std::cout << x << " = "   // Print in binary with ellipsis
00081                   << "(" << z.first << "," << z.second << ")"; // Print range
00082         double v = x.Value<double>(r); // Round exactly to nearest double
00083         std::cout << " = " << v << "\n";
00084       } else if (i == numprint)
00085         std::cout << std::flush;
00086     }
00087     std::cout
00088       << "Number of bits needed to obtain the binary representation averaged\n"
00089       << "over " << num << " samples = " << bitcount/double(num) << "\n\n";
00090   }
00091   {
00092     std::cout
00093       << "Random bits with 1 occurring with probability 1/pi exactly:\n";
00094     long long num = 100000000ll;
00095     int numprint = 72;
00096     RandomLib::InversePiProb pp;
00097     long long nbits = 0;
00098     long long k = r.Count();
00099     for (long long i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00100       bool b = pp(r);
00101       nbits += int(b);
00102       if (i < numprint) std::cout << int(b);
00103       else if (i == numprint) std::cout << "..." << std::flush;
00104     }
00105     std::cout << "\n";
00106     std::cout << "Frequency of 1 averaged over " << num << " samples = 1/"
00107               << double(num)/nbits << "\n"
00108               << "bits/sample = " << (r.Count() - k)/double(num) << "\n\n";
00109   }
00110   {
00111     std::cout
00112       << "Random bits with 1 occurring with probability 1/e exactly:\n";
00113     long long num = 1000000000ll;
00114     int numprint = 72;
00115     RandomLib::InverseEProb ep;
00116     long long nbits = 0;
00117     long long k = r.Count();
00118     for (long long i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00119       bool b = ep(r);
00120       nbits += int(b);
00121       if (i < numprint) std::cout << int(b);
00122       else if (i == numprint) std::cout << "..." << std::flush;
00123     }
00124     std::cout << "\n";
00125     std::cout << "Frequency of 1 averaged over " << num << " samples = 1/"
00126               << double(num)/nbits << "\n"
00127               << "bits/sample = " << (r.Count() - k)/double(num) << "\n";
00128   }
00129   return 0;
00130 }
